alert.note: Alert for Hancock; Harrison; Jackson; Pearl River (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 17 at 9:37PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Harrison, Hancock, Jackson and southern Pearl River Counties through 1030 PM CDT... At 937 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Deer Park to 7 miles northwest of Wade to near McHenry to near Mcneil. Movement was south at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Gulfport, Biloxi, Ocean Springs, Long Beach, Moss Point, Picayune, Bay St. Louis, Waveland, St. Martin, Escatawpa, Diamondhead, Gautier, D`iberville, Wade, Saucier, Helena, Hurley, Gulf Park Estates, Mcneil and Latimer. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 76. Interstate 59 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 23. Interstate 110 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 4. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for southeastern Louisiana...and southern Mississippi.
